dict.string:
revs=`"${TM_SVN:=svn}" log -q "$TM_FILEPATH"` #echo $revs
revs=`echo "$revs" | sed '/^------------------------------------------------------------------------$/d' | sed '/^$/d'`
revs=`osascript<<END set AppleScript's text item delimiters to {"\n","\r"} tell app "SystemUIServer" to activate tell app "SystemUIServer" to choose from list (every text item of "$revs") with prompt "Please choose two revisions:" with multiple selections allowed set theitems to the result set the result to (item 1 of theitems) & return & (item 2 of theitems) END` echo $revs
revs=`echo "$revs" | tr '\r' '\n' | cut -d "|" -f 1`
#IFS="," revs=( $revs )
echo $revs
echo "0:" ${revs[0]} echo "1:" ${revs[1]}
TMPFILE=`mktemp /tmp/tm-svn.XXXXXX` || exit 1
mv "$TMPFILE" "$TMPFILE.diff" TMPFILE="$TMPFILE.diff"
"${TM_SVN:=svn}" diff -r${revs[0]#r}:${revs[1]#r} "$TM_FILEPATH" &> "$TMPFILE"
open -a TextMate "$TMPFILE" &
#rm "$TMPFILE" # ideally, we'd do this, but it creates a # race condition, because 'open' is asynchronous.
